today_in_history_posts.title: BIP proposal - Dandelion: Privacy Preserving Transaction Propagation
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Developers introduced Dandelion, enhancing Bitcoin privacy by obscuring transaction sources.
- It employs a two-phase method: "stem" then "fluff," for controlled transaction propagation.
- Feedback is sought on its "Mempool Embargo" and ongoing testnet benchmarks are reported.

today_in_history_posts.title: BOLT 11, real time micro payments, and route redundancy
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Andy Schroder asks why BOLT 11 lacks a refund address, unlike BIP 70.
- He mentions adapting fuel pumps for Lightning needs a refund address for pre-payments.
- Questions the feasibility of real-time micropayments for cars, considering latency and bandwidth.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies include passive holding and active management of assets.
- Passive investments may lead to societal issues, such as asset underutilization and agent misalignment.
- The article suggests central banks could stabilize economies with a currency system backed by Bitcoin.
